title: Zoey Deutch lights up the red carpet in yellow shoulderless gown at Elle's Women In Hollywood event
text:
Some of the biggest female stars were among the high-profile ladies to strut their stuff at Elle's 2019 Women In Hollywood Celebration in Beverly Hills on Monday.

Scarlett Johansson, Natalie Portman, Gwyneth Paltrow and Nicole Kidman were four of the ten Hollywood heavyweights to be honored at the 26th annual event.

Also on hand to help light up the red carpet: was actress Zoey Deutch, who looked stunning in a bright yellow-patterned gown.

Scroll down to video

Commanding attention: Zoey Deutch, 24, attended Elle's 2019 Women In Hollywood Celebration at The Four Seasons Hotel in Beverly Hills on Monday

The form-fitting number helped showcase the Zombieland: Double Tap star's toned figure.

She was also able to show off her legs and her matching yellow heels with a long slit along the back seam of the design.

For the festive event, Deutch wore her bob-cut brown tresses long but she pushed her hair back behind her ears, which helped highlight her stylish dangling earrings.

Gorgeous: The design helped showcase the Zombieland: Double Tap star's toned figure

Classy: Deutch wore her bob-cut brown tresses long but she pushed her hair back behind her ears, which helped highlight her stylish dangling earrings

Along with Johansson, Portman, Paltrow and Kidman, this year's other honorees that hit the stage to address the audience included Dolly Parton, Zendaya, Mindy Kaling, Lena Waite, Melinda Matsoukas and Jodie Turner-Smith.

The event, which was presented by Ralph Lauren and Lexus at The Four Seasons Hotel in Beverly Hills, also featured such big stars as Reese Witherspoon, Charlize Theron, Margot Robbie and Diane Lane.

Jameela Jamil, Indya Moore, Joey King, Bel Powley, Diana Silvers, Rachel Zoe, Sara Foster, Melanie Liburd and Elizabeth Chambers were also among the prestigious guest list.

Sneak peek: The Zombieland: Double Tap actress was also able to show off her legs and her matching yellow heels with a long slit along the back seam of the design

Making her mark: Deutch first made waves in Hollywood with roles in the fantasy film Beautiful Creatures (2013) and the horror-comedy film Vampire Academy

Deutch, 24, has been out in force promoting the much-anticipated sequel to the 2009 hit Zombieland in recent days.

She attended the Los Angeles premiere at the Regency Village Theatre on Friday alongside her mother, Back To The Future star, Lea Thompson.

The stars of the original film - Woody Harrelson, Emma Stone, Jesse Eisenberg and Abigail Breslin - are all back for round two of the horror-comedy along with director Ruben Fleischer and writers Rhett Reese and Paul Wernick.

The first film was a critical and commercial success, grossing more than $102 million at the worldwide box office on a $23.6 million budget.
description: Zoey Deutch lit up the red carpet in a bright yellow-patterned shoulderless gown at Elle's 2019 Women In Hollywood event in Beverly Hills on Monday.
